comments.commentBody: In an interview with a former OAS gunman for whom "attentats" against the FLN and European liberals were his "pain quotidien" in 1962, during the final year of "Algerie francaise,"he summed up the shadow war between the 2 urban guerrilla  armies succinctly by saying,"Moi, je te tue; toi, tu me tues." Bref, tit for tat.Same could be said for our combined air and ground war against the Islamic State. The more we attack them the more inclined they r to retaliate by conducting massacres in Shite quarters in Baghad and the West.VP Biden, speaking with prescience, said that the ultimate solution lay in partition.A starting point towards this end would be to declare a unilateral truce, and cease offensive operations against the Islamic State. Perhaps if we commit to leaving them alone, they will cease to launch terrorist assaults against us, and the victims of the carnages at CHARLEY HEBDO, in Paris centre, San Bernardio and in Orlando would be alive today.Give peace a chance, and a peaceful coexistence might be achieved.Both sides r suffering due of the intransigence of our military and the Iranian backed militias.DIPLOMACY is worth a try.ISIS fighters r like the Palestinians generations ago, when TE LAWRENCE said they were like rain, and you cannot capture  rain.Militarily, we will never defeat ISIS. Better to learn to live with the Caliphate as the first step to dividing the country into separate spheres. ISIS is not going away soon. Its demise is not announced for tomorrow.

So, Mr. NRA Gun Lobby, just what are the benefits that we are getting from  your efforts, in exchange for these lives? What advantages of easy access to guns balance out the disadvantage of 53 young beautiful lives destroyed by hot lead bullets? Or the 32 at Virginia Tech? The 26 at Newtown, Conn?  Point out those advantages for us please. What compromise have been made, which lawmakers have been rewarded, in exchange for the tens of thousands of lives lost to easy firepower in the recent past? Are you getting a good deal for your efforts? Are your bosses satisfied with your work? Are the profits adequate? Is the ideology working out for you? Do you think it's improving life for the rest of us? Do you think it's working out for the people of Orlando right now?

Paris was a series of coordinated attacks at multiple locations. Nine terrorists were involved.

This was one guy and he was able to kill 50 people on his own. Imagine if there had been nine men armed with the same assault rifles this guy had throughout Orlando -- Disney, Universal World, Orlando International Airport, Sea World, Blizzard Beach, Florida mall. Eight other people armed like this one guy could take out an additional 400 people.

I think we need to ask ourselves two questions: Is this well-regulated? (obvious answer is NO), then how do we well-regulate? It says it right in the constitution. R-E-G-U-L-A-T-E.
Second question - how do we get money out of politics so that the constituencies get attention? My answer is if they have been in Congress for more than 10 years, I will not vote for them. Time for new blood who will pass some laws with teeth and repeal Citizens United.
The CDC studies car safety but isn't given funds (can you guess who blocks them?) from studying gun violence.

I was appalled when NPR apologized for cutting into their coverage of the shooting with, as they said, "politics". The [crass] politics to which they were referring was the published reactions to this massacre from the candidates for President of the United States, one of whom will be president in only seven months. I don't think these statements are an *interruption*; I think they provide very important knowledge regarding what will be our response to hate and violence under a new regime.
OK.  And after you're heart goes out vote Democratic.  Work to elect Democrats up and down the ticket.  Get all your friends and family to vote Democratic.  Your heart going out simply isn't enough.

He was a homophobic Islamist who was able to buy an assault weapon and mow down 100 people before he was stopped.

If we didn't sell weapons to suspects on FBI watch lists, they wouldn't be able to become security guards or buy guns.

It's a GUN problem.
When Black and Decker advertises how effectively their pressure cookers snuff out lives, you may have a point.
Read.  They were dealing with a hostage situation.

Tragedy after tragedy.. When will Congress do the right thing? Before profiling is introduced, mass shootings should be curbed with a ban on assault type weapons. It's not only ISIS sympathizers who commit these atrocities..
Somehow I don't he would be quoting the Jewish-Christian Bible.

Is the NRA and the US Republican Party responsible for the killings at Charlie Hebdo -- at the Bataclan Nightclub in Paris this November? -- in Molenbeek Belgium?

Come on. France and Belgium have the tough gun laws and bans you desire. It did not save them.

Whether the shooter pledged allegiance to ISIS is totally immaterial. The ONLY reason this attack was made possible is because of the scaremongering of the NRA and their political puppets, the Republican Party. Every single Republican in Congress has blood on their hands today.

"The way to turn this trend of mass shootings around is for there to be a trend of ATTEMPTED mass shootings that were thwarted by armed citizens who defended themselves"

Good luck with that.

The NRA will argue that if everyone in Pulse had a gun...  The NRA leadership cannot speculate  rationally.  The death toll would have been hundreds if everyone had had a gun in that sort of noisy, badly or oddly-lit (strobe lights flashing?) environment.  They don't get that.  The gunman didn't care who he killed.  Random shooting helped him reach his goal.  Random shooting on the part of the good people in the club would not have helped them reach theirs.  They would merely have accidentally killed their friends.

The NYT is trying its politically correct best to make this a hate crime. It is, of course, but it's hate against non-Muslims primarily. The fact that it was a gay nightclub this time instead of a school or movie theater or concert venue does not make it worse...or better.

What is the purpose of saying it was a "gay" nightclub in the NYT headline? Now, it is important to point out if the killer killed in the name of a particular religion or cause. That is relevant. And if it turns out that the killer thought he was carrying out his god's wishes by killing gays, then the type of club it is becomes relevant.
The problem is a combination of things.
It's called terrorism because they were killed, not "villified."

Right.  As the Red Queen said to Noam Chomsky, "Words mean what I say they mean." Indeed, look at the AR-15 rifles at Big 5 Sporting Goods: they are .223 single shots, SEMI auto.  Far less lethal than a perfectly legal semi-automatic shotgun.  Changing an AR-15 to full auto is a felony in many jurisdictions, and armor-piercing ammo for it is restricted too (while 12-gauge buckshot is not restricted at all.) Only police agencies have full auto, military-grade M-16s, right in their patrol cars. They are not civilian AR-15's.

Pffffft. The Second Amendment does not specifically mention the ownership or use of semi-automatic assault weapons or, interestingly enough, self defense.

Kid you not. Here's the exact wording: "A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State, the right of the people to keep and bear Arms, shall not be infringed." Read it and think. Maybe weep for the ones who died this morning. And don't forget the little kids at Sandy Hook. Spare a tear for them too.

JSH: James Howell was arrested today in Santa Monica. He had packed his car with guns and pipe bomb materials and was on the way to Gay Pride. The only differences are that he was stopped from carrying out his plans, and he appears not to be Muslim.

Guns and hatred are the common threads here. Radical Islam is also a problem we must face, but your suggestion that liberals and gays are in cahoots to rationalize terrorism as a way to make a political point is way off the mark. We can't control people's minds. We can control the guns, if our leaders will step up to the plate.

@NY Hugenot - the explosive class you are referring to has major stability issues.  Yes it's 'easy to make'  but, it's a lot harder to use effectively than an AR-15.  You are completely wrong on this.  Too many fringe websites of marginal accuracy have undermined your knowledge base.
Let's not forget what's happening in Paris, Brussels and other cities with strict gun laws...oops
As people keep repeatedly pointing out: what makes you think no one else in the club had a gun?
Your comments are ludicrous. You cannot compare gang members killing each other to a mass shooting of innocent people. Stop over-reaching.
